Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the fabric is partially grey in section, the interior is covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a red-brown slip and four lines of Coptic text written in black ink, worn in parts, containing a receipt.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.166)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36349) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36349)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 223 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
Miscellaneous number: SB XVIII 13395 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
